required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Diagnostic Accuracy and Performance of Digital Breast Tomosynthesis Compared to Mammography (ADAPT)
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Diagnostic Accuracy and Performance of Digital Breast Tomosynthesis Compared to Mammography (ADAPT Trial) ADAPT-BX: Recruitment Plan for Initially Asymptomatic Women Referred for Breast Biopsy

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this recruitment plan (ADAPT-BX) is to collect image and technical data on both digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT) and full-field digital mammography (FFDM), along with other subject data including histology results from biopsy specimen examination and cancer classification data from initially asymptomatic women referred for biopsy after recall from screening and diagnostic work-up. These data will be included in a subsequent and prospectively planned pooled analysis described in a separate protocol (ADAPT-BIE) examining superiority of DBT to FFDM for breast cancer diagnosis and other clinical performance measures.

detailed_description.textblock: ADAPT program consists of 2 recruitment plans (ADAPT-SCR and ADAPT-BX) followed by an off-line read of the images and data collected (ADAPT-BIE). This study involves the comparison of two devices that can identify abnormalities in routine breast screening and diagnostic mammography. Mammography is usually done with full-field digital mammography (FFDM), which takes flat, two-dimensional X-ray images of the breast. Doctors use the two-dimensional images to look for cancers and other abnormal tissue. The purpose of this study is to learn more about the accuracy of full-field digital mammography devices and a new mammography device called digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). DBT is similar to full-field digital mammography, but can also move around the breast to get X-ray images from different angles, which provides a three-dimensional view that doctors can use to look for cancers and abnormal tissue. Subjects will be recruited from an initially asymptomatic population that have been referred for clinically indicated breast biopsy based on suspicious breast imaging results. Subjects will undergo a DBT mammogram prior to biopsy. If FFDM was not performed within 30 days, subjects will also undergo FFDM prior to biopsy. Results of biopsy(ies) and histopathology, including lesion characteristics, will be recorded and considered as truth if positive for cancer status. Subjects with negative or benign histological findings will be followed for approximately one year (10-16 months) by FFDM and any additional standard of care practice.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Sponsor met enroll. need for planned second study before meeting enroll. ceiling in protocol

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants underwent 2D breast imaging with Full-field digital mammography (FFDM) and by 3D breast imaging with Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With DBT, FFDM and Biopsy Specimens Collected.
primary_outcome.description: For each participant, obtain image data using two methods (DBT and FFDM) and obtain histology results of biopsy specimens from women referred for biopsy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lesion Type Observed by FFDM Imaging
secondary_outcome.description: Lesions were characterized based on findings identified during image evaluations performed by qualified readers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lesion Type Observed by DBT Imaging
secondary_outcome.description: Lesions were characterized based on findings identified during image evaluations performed by qualified researchers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Lesion Dimension as Observed by FFDM
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum Length of Lesions (measured in mm) when images were collected using FFDM.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Lesion Dimension as Observed by DBT
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum length of lesions (measured in mm) when images were collected using DBT

secondary_outcome.measure: Biopsy Finding of Lesions Per Subject.
secondary_outcome.description: Describes histologic cancer and non-cancer findings of lesion biopsy. Cancer status of lesions was reported per subject, not per lesion.

other_outcome.description: Number of device-related malfunctions by imaging modality.

arm_group.description: Subjects underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) followed by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Digital Breast Tomosynthesis: 3D imaging of the breast using Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) device. Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device.

intervention.description: Subjects underwent breast imaging using each device: DBT and FFDM.
intervention.other_name: Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (3D breast imaging) and Full-Field Digital Mammography (2D breast imaging)

overall_official.affiliation: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

facility.name: Boca Raton Regional Hospital Christine E. Lynn Women's Health and Wellness Institute
Cooper Health - Cooper Breast Imaging Centers

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: DBT and FFDM
group.description: Subjects underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) followed by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Digital Breast Tomosynthesis: 3D imaging of the breast using Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) device. Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device. DBT and FFDM: Subjects underwent breast imaging using each device: DBT and FFDM.

group.title: DBT and FFDM
group.description: Subjects underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) followed by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Digital Breast Tomosynthesis: 3D imaging of the breast using Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) device. Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device. DBT and FFDM: Subjects underwent breast imaging using each device: DBT and FFDM.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With DBT, FFDM and Biopsy Specimens Collected.
outcome.description: For each participant, obtain image data using two methods (DBT and FFDM) and obtain histology results of biopsy specimens from women referred for biopsy.
outcome.population: Initially asymptomatic adult women presenting for breast biopsy based on prior breast imaging.

group.title: DBT and FFDM
group.description: Participants underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) and by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Digital Breast Tomosynthesis: 3D imaging of the breast using Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) device. Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device. Subjects also were referred (per standard of care) for a biopsy. Specimen was collected, and result was recorded.

measure.title: Number of Participants With DBT, FFDM and Biopsy Specimens Collected.
measure.description: For each participant, obtain image data using two methods (DBT and FFDM) and obtain histology results of biopsy specimens from women referred for biopsy.
measure.population: Initially asymptomatic adult women presenting for breast biopsy based on prior breast imaging.

category.title: Participants that completed DBT, FFDM and Biopsy
Participants that did not complete all three tests

outcome.title: Lesion Type Observed by FFDM Imaging
outcome.description: Lesions were characterized based on findings identified during image evaluations performed by qualified readers.
outcome.population: Participants with lesions evaluated by FFDM. A single participant may have more than one lesion.

group.title: DBT and FFDM
group.description: Participants underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) and by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Digital Breast Tomosynthesis: 3D imaging of the breast using Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) device. Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device. Subjects also were referred (per standard of care) for a biopsy. Specimen was collected, and result was recorded.

measure.title: Lesion Type Observed by FFDM Imaging
measure.description: Lesions were characterized based on findings identified during image evaluations performed by qualified readers.
measure.population: Participants with lesions evaluated by FFDM. A single participant may have more than one lesion.

outcome.title: Lesion Type Observed by DBT Imaging
outcome.description: Lesions were characterized based on findings identified during image evaluations performed by qualified researchers.
outcome.population: Participants with DBT breast images collected, and lesion characteristic described by qualified reader. Participants may have more than one lesion.

group.title: DBT and FFDM
group.description: Participants underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) and by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Digital Breast Tomosynthesis: 3D imaging of the breast using Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) device. Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device. Subjects also were referred (per standard of care) for a biopsy. Specimen was collected, and result was recorded.

measure.title: Lesion Type Observed by DBT Imaging
measure.description: Lesions were characterized based on findings identified during image evaluations performed by qualified researchers.
measure.population: Participants with DBT breast images collected, and lesion characteristic described by qualified reader. Participants may have more than one lesion.

outcome.title: Maximum Lesion Dimension as Observed by FFDM
outcome.description: Maximum Length of Lesions (measured in mm) when images were collected using FFDM.
outcome.population: Lesions observed and measured when images were collected when using FFDM; Seven (7) of the total 173 observed lesions were not measured.

group.title: DBT and FFDM
group.description: Participants underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) and by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Digital Breast Tomosynthesis: 3D imaging of the breast using Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) device. Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device. Subjects also were referred (per standard of care) for a biopsy. Specimen was collected, and result was recorded.

measure.title: Maximum Lesion Dimension as Observed by FFDM
measure.description: Maximum Length of Lesions (measured in mm) when images were collected using FFDM.
measure.population: Lesions observed and measured when images were collected when using FFDM; Seven (7) of the total 173 observed lesions were not measured.

outcome.title: Maximum Lesion Dimension as Observed by DBT
outcome.description: Maximum length of lesions (measured in mm) when images were collected using DBT
outcome.population: Lesions observed and measured when images were collected using DBT. Sixteen (16) of the total 192 observed lesions were not measured.

group.title: DBT and FFDM
group.description: Participants underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) and by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Digital Breast Tomosynthesis: 3D imaging of the breast using Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) device. Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device. Subjects also were referred (per standard of care) for a biopsy. Specimen was collected, and result was recorded.

measure.title: Maximum Lesion Dimension as Observed by DBT
measure.description: Maximum length of lesions (measured in mm) when images were collected using DBT
measure.population: Lesions observed and measured when images were collected using DBT. Sixteen (16) of the total 192 observed lesions were not measured.

outcome.title: Biopsy Finding of Lesions Per Subject.
outcome.description: Describes histologic cancer and non-cancer findings of lesion biopsy. Cancer status of lesions was reported per subject, not per lesion.
outcome.population: All lesions with a biopsy finding: "positive/malignant", "negative/benign" or "non-conclusive". Biopsy findings were reported per subject, not per lesion.

group.title: DBT and FFDM
group.description: Participants underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) and by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Digital Breast Tomosynthesis: 3D imaging of the breast using Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) device. Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device. Subjects also were referred (per standard of care) for a biopsy. Specimen was collected, and result was recorded.

measure.title: Biopsy Finding of Lesions Per Subject.
measure.description: Describes histologic cancer and non-cancer findings of lesion biopsy. Cancer status of lesions was reported per subject, not per lesion.
measure.population: All lesions with a biopsy finding: "positive/malignant", "negative/benign" or "non-conclusive". Biopsy findings were reported per subject, not per lesion.

outcome.title: Safety - Device Related Malfunctions
outcome.description: Number of device-related malfunctions by imaging modality.
outcome.population: Number of device malfunctions recorded for either DBT or FFDM imaging.

group.title: DBT and FFDM
group.description: Participants underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) and by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device. Subjects also were referred (per standard of care) for a biopsy. Specimen was collected, and result was recorded.

measure.title: Safety - Device Related Malfunctions
measure.description: Number of device-related malfunctions by imaging modality.
measure.population: Number of device malfunctions recorded for either DBT or FFDM imaging.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Event data were collected from June 2015 to November 2016 (1 year and 5 months).

group.title: DBT and FFDM
group.description: Subjects underwent 2D breast imaging with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) followed by 3D breast imaging with digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT). Digital Breast Tomosynthesis: 3D imaging of the breast using Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) device. Full-Field Digital Mammography: 2D imaging of the breast using Full-Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) device. DBT and FFDM: Subjects underwent breast imaging using each device: DBT and FFDM.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
